hint.text:
Terms common to both the numerator and denominator can be cancelled.
For example :
\(\frac{x^3abc}{xab},\,\)where x, a, b, c are non-zero intergers; can be expressed as
\('x^2c'\,\)because \('xab'\,\)is the common term for the numerator and denominator.

solution.text:
\(\frac{_{{j*k*l}}_x^3y^3z^3a^3b^3c^3+_{{2*k}}_x^2yx+_{{3*j*k}}_xy^2z+_{{l*k}}_xyz^2}{_{k}_xyz}\)
Taking \(_{k}_xyz\,\)common in the numerator,
\(=\frac{_{k}_xyz(_{{j*l}}_x^2y^2z^2a^3b^3c^3)+_{k}_xyz(2x)+_{k}_xyz(_{{3*j}}_y)+_{k}_xyz(_{l}_z)}{_{k}_xyz}\)
Dividing numerator and denominator by \(_{k}_xyz\),
\(=_{{j*l}}_x^2y^2z^2a^3b^3c^3+2x+_{{3*j}}_y+_{l}_z\)
